intro: Pleurothallis hartwegii, commonly known as the Hartweg's orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, linear leaves and produces intricate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. Its inflorescence is usually a raceme of small, showy blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and orchid enthusiasts alike.
